resources.string: Secrets of the Swamp
"Why did you come here?"

A question I ask myself every day, but of course, the answer is that it's my duty, as a citizen of New Corsica and of Aeternum.\n\nI believe there are secrets stirring in the primordial waters of this land.
"What kind of secrets?"
Well, it's no secret that there's power here - power beyond human imagination.\n\nThe Ancients certainly knew how to harness it - but for what purpose? Don't you want to know?
"It's a mystery worth exploring."

Then perhaps you'd assist me? An opportunity's arisen but my antiquarian has vanished. \n\nAncient Tablets from the overgrown ruins nearby, and charcoal rubbings from Ancient Plaques- collect these, and I'll reward you.
I've only just learned of these tablets, but I have high hopes.\n\nBring back the tablets or charcoal rubbings from the plaques and I'll share whatever I can translate.

Aha! Did I mention I'm a scholar of the Ancients' language? I've spent centuries studying - let's see what I can decipher here...\n\nHm. Yes, as elsewhere, it's clear they forced humans into servitude - the Guardians.
"But why did they need the Guardians?"
That is the question, isn't it? And the answer varies. In Brimstone Sands, the Guardians served entirely defensive purposes.\n\nBut here, it seems the Ancients were using some kind of... technology.
Collect Ancient Stone Tablets and Rubbings from any Ancient Plaques within Sunken Aspect, and return them to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and seek out the writings of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Take Rubbing from Ancient Plaque
Hope Springs Eternal
"We should investigate further."

I absolutely agree. There's only one additional clue I can decipher from the writings you procured.\n\nIt seems the humans made some sort of pilgrimage to a primordial spring in the northwest mountains.
"I'll go check it out."

Excellent. With Abbington at large, I'm quite stuck here and can't visit the spring myself.\n\nThere's a symbol suggesting the waters there might have some healing power - I look forward to hearing what you discover.
Healing waters in the mountains… why would the Ancients sends their servants there?\n\nPerhaps they were benevolent overlords? Hurry now, this could help us learn more!
Aha, you've returned! Unlike Abbington... at any rate, let's see what you found.\n\nHm. It appears the site was dedicated to a ritual of creation, involving... yes, some kind of devices.
Investigate the Ancient ruins of Skyview Repose, and return to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Investigate {POITags} for any clues about the Ancient Guardians
Search for any notes or clues about the Ancient Guardians
Collect the {itemName} from {targetName}
Investigate the top of the Skyview Repose tower
Paths Unseen
"Just tell me what's next."

Well, the map you recovered seems to locate the source of the devices used in the rituals.\n\nIt appears to be an underground facility hidden in the caves the locals call Rackham's Hollow. That, is where we search next.
Be wary in the caves. I've heard the Lost have domain there.\n\nBut if it gives us clues about the Ancients' technologies, it's worth any risk.

Thank the gods you've returned! I was beginning to worry! And what are these...? \n\nOh... the Guardian Hearts we've seen in other places? This suggests the ritual at the spring was... perhaps where these were... Implanted?
"That's disturbing."
I knew some Guardians were human and others were constructed, but this suggests… some were both, in fact.\n\nEven more thought-provoking - these hearts are incomplete, lifeless.
Colllect any remnants of the Ancients you can find in Rackham's Hollow. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Seek out any remnants of the Ancients in {POITags}
Seek out any remnants of the Ancients
(Optional) Search the rubble for any evidence of the Ancients
Defend against the Marooned Pirates
Search the Marooned officer for any evidence of the Ancients
Anatomy of the Heart
"Where can we learn more?"

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius - Reekwater
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: The ruins of Sha Makogai - they appear to have been the seat of the Ancients' power in this region.\n\nIf you're willing, and very careful… any artifacts remaining there may tell us more. Mars protect you, my friend.
The ruins of Sha Makogai have been explored before, but perhaps something remains there of interest.

You have proven quite capable, my friend, and helpful too. Let me see what you've recovered.\n\nIndeed, a functioning Guardian Heart... and opened? What's this inside? An azoth crystal, and... vines? From a Dryad, no less.
"The source of the Hearts' energy."

That is... not what I expected. The Ancients combined their azoth technology with the living essence of the Dryads... madness.\n\nThese tablets suggest the Dryad essence came from a… 'timeless pool'. Interesting.
Search for any remaining Ancient artifacts within the ruins of Sha Makogai. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and locate any remaining Ancient artifacts
Collect Tablets from {POITags}
Search for clues about the creation of the Ancient Guardians
Seek and Hide
"What does that mean?"

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius - Reekwater
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: It means we need to find Abbington - he knows more than I do about this business.\n\nHe was last out at the ruins of Syleio Seko - please, you must go find him… or his notes, if that's all that remains.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Abbingdon" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius - Reekwater

resources.string: Please, make haste. If Abbingdon has not returned by now, it could be bad.\n\nWe need him, or his work, at least.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Legatus" = Legatus Fulvius)
string.speaker: Antiquarian Abbingdon - Syleio Seko
string.name: AntiquarianAbbingdon

resources.string: Stellar timing! I knew Fulvius would eventually send someone.\n\nBut I couldn't leave behind this artifact I've discovered… of course, I can't seem to collect it, either.
Uncover the whereabouts of Antiquarian Abbingdon, last sent to Syleio Seko.
Search {POITags} for any evidence of Abbingdon's whereabouts
Enter the ruins and search for Antiquarian Abbingdon
Secrets Best Left Unshared
"Why not?"
Because THIS is what he's after - an artifact the Ancients used to extract souls and turn them into azoth!\n\nPower beyond comprehension! I need to get it out of here… it belongs in a museum!
"Alright. I'll help you."

Good, because these Guardians are determined to stop me.\n\nThere's an Ancient device below - if you'll activate it and distract the Guardians, I'll pry the artifact loose and take it somewhere the Legion will never find it.
"What about Fulvius?"

You… you'll have to throw him off my trail. Tell him I became Lost!\n\nBut first, distract the Guardians so I can finally extract the artifact. I promise I will hide this damn thing. Then, who knows? Perhaps we'll meet again!
Bah! I didn't have enough time to work it loose!\n\nPlease, let's try this again. We have no choice. It must be done.
Distract the Starvault Guardians downstairs, and I'll pry the relic loose. \n\nWe can do this - we have to.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius - Reekwater
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: What news, my friend? I feel we are close to finding the secrets of the Ancients here.\n\nTell me, did you find Abbingdon? What happened to the old fool?
"He's one of the Lost now."

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius - Reekwater
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: Blast it! I needed that bastard, and his research! Bah, I've had it with this place! \n\nSorry, I do appreciate your help. But next chance I get, I'm going back to Brimstone Sands!
Distract the Starvault Guardians while Antiquarian Abbingdon frees the Ancient artifact.
(Optional) Activate the Device in the lowest level of Syleio Seko
Provide a distraction for Antiquarian Abbingdon
An Expanding Threat
"What danger are you referring to?"

The Lost, the empty vessels… the Siren Queen. I told them, but others here are only concerned with the Angry Earth.\n\nNow it's Corruption everyone fears, but soon, the Siren Queen will come for us all.
"Who's the Siren Queen?"
She leads the Lost Pirates here, but she is not content with that, believe me. \n\nI was Headman of my village and watched it fall, and since then, I have watched her rise.
"Why is she so dangerous?"

Most Lost, they lack purpose; but the Siren, she has much purpose, dark purpose.\n\nSee for yourself - go to Maria's Rest - see how the Pirates' numbers grow. Destroy those you can, and you will see. Yes, you will see.
Go on now, go to Maria's Rest and see for yourself.\n\nDefeat as many pirates as you can, but it will not be enough.
[BLANK]
Investigate the Lost Pirates at Maria's Rest. Then report to Headmen Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and investigate the activities of the Pirates
Collect clues about the Pirates activities
Seek out any remaining journal pages from the questioning Pirate
Defiance and Doubt
[BLANK]
[BLANK]
Don't kill me, please! Mercy! I'm not… not with them. Not anymore! Not for a long time really…\n\nI didn't know! She was once not so bad, a good leader, brave, inspiring even…
"Who are you talking about?"
The... the Siren Queen, as she's known now. When we first came though, she promised a free society, all of us equals.\n\nBut then she changed... became that... serpent, started turning everyone Lost.
Track down the Pirate deserter, possibly hiding out in Shipflight Comb in Reekwater.
Seek out the Pirate deserter in {POITags}
Search for the Pirate deserter's hideout in {POITags}
A Hunger for Freedom
"Why are you safer here?"

Oh, because she's gonna take the whole island. I mean, she's... wait - you're working me!\n\nLook, I'll tell you things, but only if you get me food and water first. I've starved to death many times hiding here. It hurts!
I'll tell you what the Siren Queen's all about, but you gotta get me some grub first. \n\nBerries, hardtack, an old shoe - I'll eat anything at this point.

Oh, sweet mother ocean... praise you! This'll keep me fed for... I don't know how long.\n\nAlright then, I guess one good turn deserves another and all that bilge... I'll tell you about the Siren Queen.
Find, craft, or purchase Meager Meals and Fresh Water for Katring Sanders in Reekwater.
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Queen's Gambit
"For what purpose?"

Harnessing the island's magic, I figure. She's made these strange... 'banners' outta flotsam and relics.\n\nIt's like they suck the life out of you and give it to her. Ever since she put 'em up, she gets stronger.
"They should be destroyed."
You got a death wish, friend? You want to tear down the Siren Queen's banners, be my guest.\n\nJust don't say I didn't warn you. You tear those down, my old crew will be hoppin' mad.
Good luck tearing down those banners. \n\nI mean it may be the only hope, but don't ask me to do it.
Well now, look who's played the odds and lived to tell! \n\nYou're pretty mean scallywag, aren't you? Not as mean as the Queen, mind you, but you got salt.
"I destroyed the banners."
And she's already putting up more, I bet. I was thinking back to when this started...\n\nIt was after some of the crew brought back this weird magic-machine-thing from the ruins down the coast.
Destroy the mysterious Cursed Banners throughout Reekwater, then return to Katring Sanders.
Destroy Cursed Banners wherever Pirates may be found
Shivering Timbers
"What happened then?"

That's when I hid, but they started getting salvage for those banners from all the wrecks on the shoreline.\n\nIf you really want to gum up her plan, you should strike those salvage operations. Don't come back here, though.
"Why not?"
Because you're drawing attention to my hiding spot! But thanks for the grub - it'll keep me from starving for a while, I reckon.\n\nOh, and good luck against the Siren Queen! You'll need it!
I think I'll be staying here. Like I said, it's safer.\n\nI mean you got salt, but if I was a betting woman - and I am - I'd bet on the Siren Queen. No offense!

At long last, you return! I was beginning to think you might've joined the Siren Queen's crew!\n\nNow you have seen it with your own eyes, haven't you? She's as much a threat as this Corruption, I tell you.
Put a stop to the salvage operations at Scavenger's Shore and Bleachwood Coast, and report back to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and stall the Pirates' salvage operations
Collect {itemName} from a container in {POITags}
(Optional) Place Primed Powderkeg at the designated spot, then stand back
Defend against the Pirate salvage crew's assault
Words of Power
"Perhaps she's after something else."

Yes, and we must find out what that is. You have learned of this Ancient 'machine' she took from the ruins, yes?\n\nThat antiquarian - Abbington - he said her crew has been scavenging more such relics as well.
"We should find out why."
And so you must go, across the bay to the Ancient Lighthouse.\n\nSomewhere there, we will find evidence of what the Siren Queen's ultimately seeks to accomplish.
We must know what the Siren Queen ultimately seeks to accomplish before we attempt to confront her.

string.comment: male referring to female (Siren Queen), male referring to male (Johansson)
string.speaker: Headman Onizuka - Reekwater
string.name: HeadmanOnizuka

resources.string: Bless the winds that brought you back. Let me see, what clues did you find at the Lighthouse?\n\nHm. These notes suggest her 'machine' has the power to steal souls from the living and channel them into another vessel…
Search Syleio Seko for clues about the Siren Queen's plans. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Investigate {POITags} for clues about the Siren Queen's plans
Collect notes relating to the Ancient 'machine'
A Plan's Deconstruction
"Is that even possible?"
Before now, I would not have thought so, but it does confirm my suspicions.\n\nThe Siren Queen has the potential to become an even greater theat than the Corruption.
"Not if we stop her first."

I only hope we're not too late. This is why her crew was bringing those relics into my old village - Mistywater Thorp.\n\nYou must go there and recover or destroy these devices - whatever they are - to stop her from gaining more power.
I believe the Siren Queen's crew is using the relics to create more of these banners they put up across the territory.\n\nYou must put a stop to this.

You have done well. There are already reports that there are fewer of those cursed banners.\n\nLet us hope that this will arrest or at least very much slow down the Siren Queen's efforts. This settlement may well be spared.
"Let's hope so."
Indeed, at some time, I suspect we will have to confront the Siren Queen herself.\n\nBut for now, you have done a tremendous service for all of Reekwater. Take this figt as a token of our thanks.
Destroy the twisted Ancient relics in Mistywater Thorp. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Search {POITags} and destroy any Ancient relics found
Seek and destroy the twisted Ancient Relics stored in Mistywater Thorp
The Queen is Dead (Elite)
"Let's not keep her Highness waiting, then."

Ha! Well said, {playerName}!\n\nNow, the Siren Queen’s lieutenants have spread throughout that hodgepodge 'fortress' to the south, one of whom holds the key to her sanctum... but we've been unable to discover which one.
"So I’ll need to find them all."

Yes, to cause the greatest impact – and to succeed, you’ll need allies by your side. Without her lieutenants enforcing her orders, her grip may loosen for a time. But that's not the only goal to keep in mind.
"The machine?"

Exactly. You'll need to find a way to deal with that infernal machine the Siren Queen has cobbled together. A few well-placed casks of gunpowder should do nicely.\nThen, you'll have to confront the Siren Queen herself.

After you light off that gunpowder, the Siren Queen won’t be pleased at all. You and your allies will need to be ready for the fierce battle ahead of you. I’ve heard the Siren Queen has control over storms. Be careful.
We saw the plume of smoke from here, and heard the lightning strikes of the Siren Queen's fury! Since you made it back... can I assume she has been dealt with?
"For the moment, yes."

Even if she may return and reclaim her fortress, you removed the greater threat of her machine – something the island can’t restore!\nYou've given us a respite from the threat, and that’s worthy of praise, {playerName}!
"What now?"

I've spoken with Nelda at the bar - she'll keep her ears open for word of the Siren Queen's return and let you know if and when it happens.\nBut for now, please take these as thanks and a reward for all of your assistance.
Hunt down the Siren Queen's lieutenants, destroy the Ancient Machine, and defeat the Siren Queen. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Venture into {POITags} and put a stop to the Siren Queen's plans
Eliminate the {targetName}s in {POITags}
Search containers for {itemName}s
Destroy the Ancient Machine
Loot the {itemName} from one of the Siren Queen's lieutenants
Defeat the Siren Queen
Long Live the Queen (Elite)
Hunt down the Siren Queen's lieutenants, acquire a key, and defeat the Siren Queen. \n\n(This Quest can be shared and repeated)
"Didn't take them long at all."
Sadly, no. Elsewhere on Aeternum, could take a week to come back... around here, it's always faster. Must be something in the water.\nAnyway. Are you and your friends ready to tangle with her again?
"Of course."

Glad to hear it!\nNow, that machine may be destroyed, but her crew still holds the keys to the kingdom. You'll need to hunt down the key again, then deal with the Siren Queen. You already know the way up. Good hunting!

Go on, off with you. You’ve things to do, I’ve things to do, and standing around won’t make any of them happen faster. Besides, you’ve kicked the Siren Queen back out to sea in the past, I expect you to succeed again!
Travel to {POITags}
(Optional) Acquire a {itemName}
Defeat the Siren Queen
On Floral Fauna
"What sort of trouble?"

These lands are sacred to nature, and any affront to nature on Aeternum will cause a reaction here.\n\nThe relentless spread of Corruption has imbued the Dryads with unnatural strength, strength that threatens the balance.
"Is there something we can do?"

I am unsure. I have studied the lifeforms of Reekwater for many years, collecting observations.\n\nBut I lost my journals in Glimmerfen recently when the Dryads became hostile. Would you mind reclaiming them?
My journals contain decades of insights regarding Reekwater and the Angry Earth.\n\nThey must be reclaimed or all my work will have been in vain.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Oh praise the Earth mother you've returned! These journals are everything to me.\n\nI hope my work might help us placate the Angry Earth in this turmoil and someday bring us back into harmony with one another.
"Is such harmony possible?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: I believe it is… no, I know it is. Marsh Walker Afolabi will tell you otherwise, but she is stuck in the old ways of thinking.\n\nLet me study my journals, then I hope you'll return so we can discuss this further.
Retrieve the Dryad journals dropped by Herbalist Langlais in the Glimmerfen. Then return it to her in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and search for the missing journals
Collect Journal: "Underestimated Intelligence"
Collect Journal: "The Promenade"
Collect Journal: "Vindicta Aeternum"
Pruning and Irrigation
"Why didn't you help her?"

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi - Reekwater
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Because she has much to learn, and her growth can only be accelerate by adversity… but you have done no harm.\n\nPerhaps there is another way we might hasten her enlightenment?
"What do you propose?"

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi - Reekwater
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Madilon believes the Dryads come from across Aeternum to protect and care for nature here. I suspect otherwise. \n\nCollect fresh Dryad samples and water from the azoth springs in Glimmerfen. Then we will know more.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi - Reekwater

resources.string: The fresh Dryad samples and azoth water will give us greater insights.\n\nTrust the process, young one.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi - Reekwater
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Thank you, child. Some might shy away from the Dryads when they seethe as they do. You are brave.\n\nAnd indeed these samples prove that the Dryads in Glimmerfen come from all over the island.
Provide Marsh Walker Afolabi with her requested fresh Dryad Cuttings from the Glimmerfen, and Azoth Water from Azoth Springs.
Travel to {POITags} and gather the items for Marsh Walker Afolabi
Collect {itemName}s from the Dryads of the {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from Azoth Springs throughout Reekwater
New Growth
"Are you going to tell me?"

I am, but first, I ask your assistance in addressing a concern of my own. \n\nWhile Madilon has walked these waters for decades, I have done so for centuries, but I have never seen pure azoth crystals here... until now.
"Where did you see them?"

I saw them in the Virid Grotto, but the fury of the Dryads in the area was fierce - I could not reach them.\n\nIf you collect these crystals from the grotto, I will grant you both knowledge and a rare gift.
The Dryads in the grotto are enraged to a degree unlike any time I've seen in the past.\n\nDo take care collecting the crystals.

Your return warms my blood, young one. Let me see these crystals.\n\nAzoth indeed, and most peculiar to be growing there. I will have to study them, but I think I promised you something in return… what was it?
"Knowledge and a gift, I believe."

Of course. You'll also remember the question of why Dryads come to Reekwater.\n\nI will tell you this much - it is 'for the water' that they come. The rest, you'll learn in time. Oh, and here's your gift.
Search the Virid Grotto for azoth crystals, and bring pieces of them back for Marsh Walker Afolabi in the Reekwater Settlement.
Seek out the Azoth Crystals within the {POITags}
Collect samples of {itemName}s
Excising the Blighted Root
"Where do we start?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: The greatest factor in the destabilization of nature now is of course the Blight.\n\nI suspect you have seen it elsewhere, but the threat is greater here, because the gathering of Dryads could cause it to spread.. well, everywhere.
"So it must be purged quickly?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Exactly. The infected Dryads must be destroyed, particularly one large one in Lambent Muskeg.\n\nDestroy it and retrieve any Blight nodules. Then please also make sure it hasn't spread to Fisher's Glory.
Blight cannot be allowed to take hold here in Reekwater. The stakes are too high.
Good to see you back in one piece. Let us hope that your actions today helped curb the Blight.\n\nIt is a great relief to learn it hasn't spread to Fisher's Glory.

Hunt down The Blight Bringer and any Blight Nodules in Lambent Muskeg, then travel to Fisher's Glory to ensure the Blight has not spread. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and stop the spread of the Blight
Find and eliminate the {targetName}
Destroy the Blight Nodules
Defeat the {targetName} Dryads to ensure the Blight has not spread
Burden of Atonement
"How do we atone?"

It is not difficult. Place this offering on the altar at the foot of Fisher's Glory, so they all can see it.\n\nJust... be on guard. One of the large dryads might come to forcibly extract your amends.
I appreciate you humoring me with this penance.\n\nMarsh Walker Afolabi would say we're wasting our time, but time will tell.
Ah, I can sense some measure of serenity returning to the marshes.\n\nYou have done the right thing, regardless of what anyone else says.
Take the Dryad Offering to the Mysterious Altar in Fisher's Glory as an apology. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and make an offering at the Dryad's altar
Seek out the Dryad's altar
(Optional) Place the Dryad Offering on the Mysterious Altar
Complete the Dryad's Trial of Penance
Upstream Investigation
"She says it's 'for the water'."
For the water, you say? She really believes it's to bathe themselves in the azoth-infused waters here?\n\nI simply cannot imagine their motive to be so self-centered, so... self-indulgent.
"Perhaps there's more to it."

Not to the Marsh Walker's mind, I suspect. But let's try to prove her wrong.\n\nThe Ancients knew such matters. Would you indulge me and search some of the older ruins for clues to why the Dryads gather here?
I'm convinced that the Ancient ruins will give us insights.\n\nIf you don't find anything at first, just… keep trying.
Search Sha Makogai and the fallen lighthouse, Hingatirn, for any clues on the Dryads' presence in Reekwater. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.

So you found something then? Let's see... oh dear, this is quite dreadful!\n\nThe Ancients dissected the Dryads for some nefarious purpose... I wonder if that's related to them coming here. Perhaps some cycle of vengeance?
"What about this sketch?"
This isn't of Ancient design... this is something else. Much simpler. Perhaps a child's drawing? \n\nAnd what is this body of water? It appears to be a sacred place to the Dryads.
Explore {POITags} for any clues to the Dryads' presence
Search the lower ruins for clues to the Dryads' presence
Collect Clues about the Dryads
Investigate the fallen tower of Hingatirn
Search for further clues connecting the Dryads to the Ancients
The Eternal Pool (Elite)
"We should go there."

Absolutely. It appears to be on the northern plateau, and that is indeed a place the Dryads protect quite fiercely.\n\nI'm sure it's where we'll learn the truth about them. Go if you dare, but I suggest you don't go alone.

There could be anything waiting for you up on the plateau. Best gather some friends and watch yourself.\n\nAnd make sure you take notes, and collect anything you can find! I want to hear about everything you see there!
Investigate the Eternal Pool and face whatever challenges lie within. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: You... returned. I can't even imagine what you must've witnessed there. The pool is pure azoth, isn't it?\n\nYes, I've spent more time studying the sketches you recovered. The pool is reason the Dryads come to Reekwater.
"It's where they go to die."

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais - Reekwater
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Yes, just as Afolabi hinted, they give their life energy to the water, returning the azoth back to Aeternum. It's inspiring.\n\nI have learned more today about the Angry Earth, about nature, and most of all, that I have more to learn.
Travel to the {POITags}
Breach the Dryad Veils
Collect Ancient relics from containers
Collect {itemName} from the Pride of the Trees
Defeat the {targetName}
The Dryad Promenade (Elite)
"What's still out of balance?"
The Protector of the Source exceeds his mandate - the pool belongs to all life forms.\n\nLike other Dryads, he too must return his essence to the waters. Do what must be done, young one.
To defeat the Protector of the Source, I would suggest you bring allies.
[BLANK]
Follow the Dryad Promenade path into the depths of the Eternal Pool, and lay the Protector of the Source to rest.\n\n(This Quest can be shared and repeated)
Travel to the {POITags}
(Optional) Acquire a {itemName}
Defeat the {targetName}
Grasping at Shadows
"Oh? What's that?"

A weapon which channels the power of... I'm not entirely certain, actually. The one I have is broken.\nIt looks akin to those other gauntlets I've seen, the ones that channel the darker energies of the island, though we won't know for sure until it is fixed.
"So you need my help to fix it?"

Spot on!\nFrom those other gauntlets, I was able to pull together a list of what should be needed to fix it. One of the few powerful items from the past constructed by our hands, not the Ancients!\nSo, help me fix it, and the gauntlet is yours.
I'll wait here for your return, don't worry.\nFulvius doesn't have any reason to doubt you, and I'm quite skilled in the art of disguise. The next time he sees me, he won't even recognize who I am.
Gather the components needed to reconstruct Umbra's Reach
Complete Quest: In Brightest Light
Complete Quest: Stygian Channel
Complete Quest: Grasping Twilight
Complete Quest: A Stitch of Shade
Complete Quest: In Darkest Shadow
Complete Quest: Power of the Void
Complete Quest: Dusky Focus
Complete Quest: Hold Back the Night
A pleasure to see you, as always!\nNow, how goes the progress on our little shopping list? Have you found everything I needed?
"Yes, I have it all."
Perfect! Here, let me... yes, these will do nicely.\nI've prepared what I could while you were out, so these repairs shouldn't take long at all.
"Take your time."

... tighten this like so, and... there! Finished!\nA shame... this should be in a museum as well, but with all that's going on, it would just go to waste there.\nThere were notes found nearby, but everything was in Gaelic! Likely a name in there as well, but I think I'll call it "Umbra's Reach". Catchy, isn't it? Use it well, {playerName}, and good luck!

The Original Guardian (Expedition)
Collect the Guardian's Eye from Chardis in the Lazarus Well Expedition. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
"What's the Lazarus Well?"
I'm not entirely sure, but some of the glyphs show images of a massive, many-eyed Ancient Guardian.\n\nSomething like this has never been seen, of course, so one would assume it is very dangerous.
"I can handle the danger."
Very well. You certainly seem capable enough to me, but you might want to bring allies.\n\nDefeat this… Original Guardian Chardis in the Lazarus Well and bring me his eye. You will be well-rewarded.
If you can get me the eye of that Original Guardian, this journey won't have been a waste after all.
You survive the Lazarus Well? After you left, I deciphered clues suggesting it was even more dangerous than I knew.\n\nBut you did it! And more importantly, the Eye! Yes, this... is quite a prize!
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Guardian Chardis for {itemName}
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Guardian Chardis for {itemName}
